result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Daniel Luebke Jr

records.addlTxt:
9:02 AM Defendant Scott Daniel Luebke Jr appeared by phone.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by phone for Scott Daniel Luebke Jr.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. State's motion to modify bond based on a poor Day Reporting, deft is non-compliant. Atty Derksen states client has some on gong battles but has made progress on those by attending counseling in West Bend and scheduled for another UA today, previous UA cleaned out of his system and request bond remain as is at $500 and then client can continue counseling. Court does not increase bond but sets plea hearing and trial date / removes 12.12.22 Status date on the calendar. Court directs deft to come to courthouse and sign his bond no later than Wednesday, November 2, 2022.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:36 AM Defendant Scott Daniel Luebke Jr appeared by phone.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by phone for Scott Daniel Luebke Jr.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
State's motion to modify due to poor Day Reporting performance. Court notes that an updated report was received last week Friday noting non-compliance.
State requesting Court to raise cash bail.
Defense requesting Court not to raise bail and states Deft is aware he needs to become compliant with Day Reporting.
Court increases bond $400.00 - total of $500.00 and needs to be posted by noon today or Deft to turn self into Detention Center.

8:41 AM Defendant Scott Daniel Luebke Jr appeared by phone. Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by phone for Scott Daniel Luebke Jr.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviews motion to modify bond based on day reporting performance (Doc 18).
State requests an increase in cash bond.
Defense requests that the bond remain as set. 
Court orders a $100 cash bond w/same conditions. Deft to post/sign bond by 5pm on 8/26/22 or turn himself into the detention center. 
Future dates previously set.
